panels.content:
Cisco Systems - UCS Traffic Monitoring - Server

Traffic monitoring of a server and related entities like vNIC/vHBA, backplane ports, etc.

  • Search a service profile from the drop down menu at the top of the page.
  • Use the 'UCS Domain' drop down menu to limit the scope to a specific UCS domain or select 'All' to search from all the available service profiles

panels.description: Displayed color (Green/Orange) based on the operational state of the service profile

targets.query: SELECT "oper_state_code" FROM "autogen"."Servers" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/) AND $timeFilter
select domain from (select domain,last(admin_state) from "autogen"."Servers" where "service_profile"  =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND $timeFilter)
select domain_name from (select domain_name,last(bytes_rx_delta) from "autogen"."VnicStats" where "service_profile"  =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND $timeFilter)
select id from (select id,last(admin_state) from "autogen"."Servers" where "service_profile"  =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND $timeFilter)
select location from (select location,last(admin_state) from "autogen"."Servers" where "service_profile"  =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND $timeFilter)
select chassis from (select chassis,last(admin_state) from "autogen"."Servers" where "service_profile"  =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND $timeFilter)
SELECT last("model") FROM "autogen"."Servers" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/) AND $timeFilter
SELECT last("oper_state") FROM "autogen"."Servers" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/) AND $timeFilter
select sum(last) from (SELECT last("num_cpus") FROM "autogen"."Servers" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/) AND $timeFilter)
select sum(last) from (SELECT last("num_cores") FROM "autogen"."Servers" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/) AND $timeFilter)

SELECT last("operability") FROM "autogen"."Servers" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/) AND $timeFilter
SELECT last("association") FROM "autogen"."Servers" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/) AND $timeFilter

panels.description: **Use Case**: Find traffic utilization and top talkers on backplane ports (between IOM/FEX and server) **How to use**: Look for overutilization of backplane ports. Also find the busiest/top-talker vNIC/vHBA on that backplane port. **Details**: - Over-utilized backplane port may lead to packet drop or congestion or both. Also look under Congestion monitoring to monitor PAUSE frames

targets.query: SELECT "speed"  /"speed" AS "TX % Max" FROM "BackplanePortStats" WHERE ("to_service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "bp_port" =~ /^$bp_port$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "bp_port" fill(linear)

SELECT mean("bytes_tx_delta")*8*1.1/[[polling_interval]]/mean("speed")*1000000000 AS "TX % Util" FROM "BackplanePortStats" WHERE ("to_service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "bp_port" =~ /^$bp_port$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "bp_port" fill(linear)

panels.title: Backplane port $bp_port (TX) breakdown per vHBA/vNIC (RX)

panels.description: **Use Case**: Find traffic utilization and top talkers on backplane ports (between IOM and blade server) **How to use**: Look for overutilization of backplane ports. Also find the busiest/top-talker vNIC/vHBA on that backplane port. **Details**: - Over-utilized backplane port may lead to packet drop or congestion or both. Also look under Congestion monitoring to monitor PAUSE frames

targets.query: SELECT "speed"  /"speed" AS "TX % Max" FROM "BackplanePortStats" WHERE ("to_service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "bp_port" =~ /^$bp_port$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "bp_port" fill(linear)

SELECT mean("bytes_tx_delta")*8*1.1/[[polling_interval]]/mean("speed")*1000000000 AS "TX % Util" FROM "BackplanePortStats" WHERE ("to_service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "bp_port" =~ /^$bp_port$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "bp_port" fill(linear)

panels.description: **Use Case**: Find traffic congestion on backplane ports (between IOM and blade server) **How to use**: A sustained spike in PAUSE frame rate is a good indication of congestion. Increase in traffic rate at the same time is a very strong evidence of congestion and also signals that congestion is due to over-utilization. **Details**: - The graphs show PAUSE frame and traffic rate on backplane ports which connect blade servers and IOM within a UCS chassis. - PAUSE frames are sent by a traffic receiver when it is unable to receive the traffic at the incoming rate. - On a port, RX traffic should be compared againt TX PAUSE and vice-versa. - Focus on (sustained) spikes only because PAUSE frames may be exchanged under normal condition also. - PAUSE frames are not reported at a per vNIC/vHBA level.
panels.title: PAUSE frames vs traffic - Backplane port $bp_port with vHBA/vNIC breakdown

targets.query: select last(service_profile) as "sp" from (select service_profile,bytes_rx_delta from "autogen"."VnicStats" where "service_profile"  =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND $timeFilter)
select last(vif_name) as "vif" from (select vif_name,bytes_rx_delta from "autogen"."VnicStats" where "service_profile"  =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "vif_name" =~ /^$vif$/ AND $timeFilter)
select last(chassis) as "chassis" from (select chassis,bytes_rx_delta from "autogen"."VnicStats" where "service_profile"  =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND $timeFilter)

select last(iom_backplane_port) as "bp_port" from (select iom_backplane_port,bytes_rx_delta from "autogen"."VnicStats" where "service_profile"  =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "vif_name" =~ /^$vif$/ AND $timeFilter)
select last(fi_id) as "fi" from (select fi_id,bytes_rx_delta from "autogen"."VnicStats" where "service_profile"  =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "vif_name" =~ /^$vif$/ AND $timeFilter)

select last(pinned_uplink) as "pinned_uplink" from (select pinned_uplink,bytes_rx_delta from "autogen"."VnicStats" where "service_profile"  =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "vif_name" =~ /^$vif$/ AND $timeFilter)
select last(bound_veth) as "veth" from (select bound_veth,bytes_rx_delta from "autogen"."VnicStats" where "service_profile"  =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "vif_name" =~ /^$vif$/ AND $timeFilter)
select last(bound_vfc) as "vfc" from (select bound_vfc,bytes_rx_delta from "autogen"."VnicStats" where "service_profile"  =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "vif_name" =~ /^$vif$/ AND $timeFilter)

panels.description: **Use Case**: Verify (uniform) traffic distribution over FI-A and FI-B. **How to use**: Give a quick look to the graph on the left and the graph on the right. If they look similar, traffic distribution is uniform. **Details**: Inbound and Outbound traffic over FI-A and FI-B is shown side-by-side with the granularity of traffic type (FC/Ethernet) and vNIC/vHBA.

**Use Case**: Verify (uniform) traffic distribution over FI-A and FI-B. **How to use**: Give a quick look to the graph on the left and the graph on the right. If they look similar, traffic distribution is uniform. **Details**: Inbound and Outbound traffic over FI-A and FI-B is shown side-by-side with the granularity of traffic type (FC/Ethernet) and vNIC/vHBA.

targets.query: SELECT sum("bytes_rx_delta")  *8/ [[polling_interval]]/([[__interval_ms]]/([[polling_interval]] * 1000)) AS "RX Traffic" FROM "autogen"."VnicStats" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "transport" = 'FC') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time([[__interval_ms]]ms),  fi_id fill(linear)

SELECT sum("bytes_tx_delta")  *8/ [[polling_interval]]/([[__interval_ms]]/([[polling_interval]] * 1000)) AS "TX Traffic" FROM "autogen"."VnicStats" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "transport" = 'FC') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time([[__interval_ms]]ms), fi_id fill(linear)

SELECT sum("bytes_rx_delta")  *8/ [[polling_interval]]/([[__interval_ms]]/([[polling_interval]] * 1000)) AS "RX Traffic" FROM "autogen"."VnicStats" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "transport" = 'Eth') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time([[__interval_ms]]ms), fi_id fill(linear)

SELECT sum("bytes_tx_delta")  *8/ [[polling_interval]]/([[__interval_ms]]/([[polling_interval]] * 1000)) AS "TX Traffic" FROM "autogen"."VnicStats" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "transport" = 'Eth') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time([[__interval_ms]]ms), fi_id fill(linear)

SELECT mean("bytes_rx_delta")  *8/ [[polling_interval]] AS "RX Traffic" FROM "autogen"."VnicStats" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "fi_id" = 'A' AND "transport" = 'FC') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1m), "vif_name", "service_profile" fill(linear)

SELECT mean("bytes_rx_delta")  *8/ [[polling_interval]] AS "RX Traffic" FROM "autogen"."VnicStats" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "fi_id" = 'B' AND "transport" = 'FC') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1m), "vif_name", "service_profile" fill(linear)
